doc:
Madge Sinclair https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madge_Sinclair 0 Madge Dorita Sinclair (née Walters; 28 April 1938 or 1940 (sources differ) – 20 December 1995) was a Jamaican actress, best known for her roles in Cornbread, Earl and Me (1975), Coming to America (1988), Trapper John, M.D. (1980-1986), and the ABC TV miniseries Roots (1977). Sinclair also voiced the character of Sarabi, Mufasa's wife and Simba's mother, in the animated feature film The Lion King. Sinclair won the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress - Drama Series for her role as Empress Josephine in Gabriel's Fire in 1991. Madge_Dorita_Sinclair ( née_Walters ; 28_April_1938 or 1940 ( sources differ ) – 20_December_1995 ) was a_Jamaican_actress , best_known for her_roles in Cornbread_,_Earl_and_Me ( 1975 ) , Coming to America ( 1988 ) , Trapper_John , M.D. ( 1980-1986 ) , and the_ABC_TV_miniseries_Roots ( 1977 ) . Sinclair also voiced the_character of Sarabi , Mufasa 's_wife_and_Simba 's_mother , in the_animated_feature_film The_Lion_King . Sinclair won the_Primetime_Emmy_Award for Outstanding_Supporting_Actress - Drama Series for her_role as Empress_Josephine in Gabriel 's_Fire in 1991 .
